fieldGroup.template:
Project types.

1.- Type I projects: Projects in which the following three circumstances simultaneously coexist:

  • a) Involving exclusively procedures classified as 'non-recovery', 'mild' or 'moderate'.
  • b) Not using primates.
  • c) Being performed to meet legal or regulatory requirements, or for production or diagnostic purposes by established methods.

Type I projects may be processed under a simplified procedure and not be subject to retrospective evaluation.


2.- Type II projects: Projects in which the following circumstances simultaneously coexist:

  • a) Involving exclusively procedures classified as 'non-recovery', 'mild' or 'moderate'.
  • b) Not using primates.

Type II projects will be subject to the authorisation procedure and may not be subject to retrospective evaluation.


3.- Type III projects: Projects other than Type I or II. Without prejudice to any additional authorisations to which certain projects may be subject, all Type III projects will be subject to the authorisation procedure and will subsequently be subject to a retrospective evaluation.
